intro: Diplostephium perijaense, commonly known as the Perijan spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which is characterized by its milky sap and often showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky areas, adapting to the harsh conditions of its environment. Its leaves are usually alternate and simple, with a distinctive shape that aids in identification. The flowers are small and clustered, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
